title: Girl, 7, grazed by bullet; man shot in leg
content:
Mother said gunfire rang out on Seventh Street and immediately her daughter began screaming
WILMINGTON -- A 7-year-old girl was grazed by a bullet, and a man was shot in the leg in a shooting near Seventh and Queen streets late Monday, according to police.
The city’s gunfire detection system alerted police to the gunfire at 9:55 p.m., said Wilmington Police Department spokeswoman Cathryn Lindsay.
According to the mother of the girl, she and her daughter were walking on Seventh Street when the woman saw a man standing outside a silver sedan talking with someone sitting inside. After she and her daughter passed several gunshots were fired. The mother told police her daughter began screaming and she found the girl's ear had been grazed by a bullet. Police also located the 24-year-old man the mother had seen earlier with a gunshot wound to the leg.
Both the girl and the man were taken to the hospital. Lindsay said the male victim was not cooperating with police. The victims' names were not released.
Anyone with information is asked to call the Wilmington Police Department at 910-343-3609 or anonymously submit a tip via Text-A-Tip. Send “Tip708” and the information to 274637 (CRIMES).
